scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You then acknowledged the team's feelings and opened the floor for discussion. Now, Monica sighs and says, 'Even if we discuss our concerns, the time isn't going to magically expand.' Bob, rubbing his temples, mutters, 'This is just going to be a disaster waiting to happen.' You showed understanding of the team's feelings and proposed a practical solution, suggesting to prioritize the most critical tasks. Monica, however, appears skeptical and asks, 'But what if even the critical tasks can't be completed on time?'
scenes.description: Bob, leaning back in his chair, adds, 'We might seriously need to consider abandoning some tasks altogether.'

options.text: I understand the concern. Let's list all tasks and see if we can delegate some of them or bring in additional resources.
options.analysis: You showed empathy and proposed a practical solution to delegate tasks or bring in more resources, demonstrating good emotional perception and social skills.

options.text: I know it's challenging, but we need to focus on what we can control. Let's give it our best shot with the resources we have.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay focused on what they can control and to give their best effort, showing good self-regulation and motivation.

options.text: If anyone has a better idea or a more efficient way to get this done, now's the time to speak up. Otherwise, let's get back to work.
options.analysis: You opened the floor for suggestions but also pushed the team to continue working, showing moderate emotion perception and self-regulation.
